item.title: Trip Hazard BT pavement cover, 10th February
item.description:
This is sinking and rocking. It has a lifted area as a trip hazard. It feels like it will collapse. It is on Le May Avenue joining Somertrees Avenue. It is getting worse and has been like it over a year

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Le May Avenue, Chinbrook, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish dumped on Somertrees avenue including paint pots. Bag chucked in trees behind wall too heavy to lift it over for me., 10th February
item.description:
There is 3 areas in Somertrees Avenue flytipping, Hope Close, and Le May Avenue wire Mattress and Balder Rise double mattress. Thats four rds joining each other. The area is becoming littered and awful all the way up to the station. It needs a team on this area. The pavements need blasting towards the station opposite Tesco with debris and litter. Some of the rubbish has been there since before Christmas. There is also a dangerous pavement cover on the corner of Somertrees and Le May. Its a trip hazard and could collapse

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Le May Avenue, Chinbrook, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Countdown unit not working, 10th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Old Street Promenade of Light, Finsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lethally Dangerous Footway Crossing, 10th February
item.description:
South East corner of Leighton / Brecknock - Accident waiting to happen. Reported earlier today via FmS App as https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/8883882 but this was allocated to LB Islington. They helpfully email me directly saying "Thanks for raising the following request but unfortunately, we LBI do not maintain that section of FW and it is down to Camden council to maintain , please could I ask you to report this via there online portal . " So over to you LB Camden.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 186, Leighton Road, Tufnell Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White globe lamp out fronting 131 Croydon Rd, Elmers End about 40m east of Elmers End Green on a traffic island., 10th February
item.description:
White globe lamp out fronting 131 Croydon Rd, Elmers End about 40m east of Elmers End Green on a traffic island. Also, please would you arrange for 'pedestrian island white pole lamps' and 'orange zebra bossing belisha beacons' to be added to the Fix My Street options. It is frustrating having to report them under sign lamps and explain every time. Choosing 'street lamp' only gives you yellow dots of actual street lamps. . The white globe lamps seem to regularly fail, more so than other street lights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
